description.narrative: To support the Government of Brazil to improve the coordination and strengthen the capacity among key federal institutions in the water sector toward an integrated approach.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 | Description :The Borrower shall establish and thereafter maintain, until thecompletion of the execution of the Project, an interministerial management committee to convene at least once every semester. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.3 | Description :The Borrower shall establish, and thereafter operate and maintain,until the completion of the execution of the Project, Project management units physically located in ANA, MMA, MI and MCid. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 | Description :The Borrower, through ANA, MMA, MI or MCid, shall, prior to carryingout any activity which requires the assistance of a Participating Entity enter into an agreement with the relevant Entity. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule, Section I.A.4 | Description :The Borrower shall establish no later than three months after theestablishment of the ComitÃƒÂƒÃ‚Âª Gestor do Programa and thereafter maintain, until the completion, a Project technicalSecretariat. | Due Date :24-Jul-2012

title.narrative: Percentage of Project amount executed in water sector integrated actions
Metropolitan regions with water supply integrated planning developed
Action strategies proposals prepared in the following themes: (i) reuse of treated effluents; and (ii) water supply in the surroundings of large water infrastructure works
Technical Hydraulic Infrastructure, Irrigation, Civil Defense and Regional Development manuals established.
Seminars, workshops or technical meetings held (cumulative).
National and/or regional planning instruments developed in an integrated manner

actual.value: 2 (National Sewage Atlas completed; and National Water Security Plan to be completed by January 2018)

title.narrative: WSS service providers supported by the Project, which are implementing non-revenue water management and energy efficiency programs,supplying services to at least 12 million users
Regulators supported by the Project represent 12 million WSS service users with access to services which are formally regulated according to Law 11.445

target.value: Regulators represent 12 million WSS service users.

actual.value: Regulators represent 36.2 million USS services users.

title.narrative: Ecological-Economic Macro Zoning of Sao Francisco River Basin completed
Technical Staff in the areas of Hydraulic Infrastructure, Irrigation, Civil Defense and Regional Development have been trained
Number of critical basins of special interest* to the countryâ€™s water resources management with qualitative and quantitative water balance finalized for improved water resources management.
Studies finalized contributing to improve the analysis of water rights concession
Progress reports, financial management and audits of the program prepared
Number of water utilities that the Project is supporting. (Core Indicator)
Service providers, users of the Sanitation Integrated Management System â€“ GSAN, benefitted by the System€™s updating and revision
Water resources management institutions supported by the Project
Professional specialists, members of the National Water Resources System (SINGREH) trained*. (*Through training activities, courses, technical visits carried out by the Project).
Interministerial Mgmt. Committee , at the Executive Sector Secretariats or Directors (ANA) level, established and functioning regularly with all institutions that participate in Interaguas.

target.value: Committee established and functioning, meeting twice a year at the Executive Sector Secretariats or Directors (ANA) level.

actual.value: Committee established and maintained over the life of the project, meeting on average every eight months.

title.narrative: National Water Resources Plan revised (second revision) and adopted.
Guidelines for drought preparedness and response developed within MI
National Irrigation Plan prepared and completed
A water portal with access to sector-specific information systems, studies, and analytical work is implemented and available to thepublic.

target.value: Functioning and Available to the Public

actual.value: A project website was created and is functioning housed by the National Water Agency including the main project results. Thewebpage is being updated to include links to the different water related systems and databases under the Ministries of Environment,Cities and National Integration, to be completed by end of December 2018: http://interaguas.ana.gov.br/Paginas/Docs.aspx.

title.narrative: Rural water and sanitation program improved including technology and management innovations

target.value: Technologic and institutional proposals for rural Water and Sanitation elaborated

title.narrative: The WSS National Info System (SINISA) implemented including all its subsectors (potable water supply, sanitation, solid waste, and drainage) and modules and functioning.

baseline.value: SINISA functioning with WSS subsectors and operational module

target.value: SINISA functioning with WSS, Solid Waste, Urban Drainage subsectors and operational and institutional modules

actual.value: The current WSS National Information System (SNIS) was improved, making improvements in the WSS and Solid Waste modules andimplementing the urban drainage module. SNIS is now in compliance with the requirements of the National Basic Sanitation Law,comprising the 4 subsectors – water supply, sanitation, solid waste and drainage, the information is available on-line at:http://www.snis.gov.br/. In addition, MCid is developing SINISA to further upgrade the system. Some improvements were also fundedby the Project.

target.value: Unit Functioning integrating other technical areas and established within the Ministry structure.

actual.value: Unit Functioning integrating other technical areas and established within the Ministry structure.

title.narrative: Strategic Actions Plan for Rehabilitation of Federal Dam Safety established and under implementation

actual.value: Plan completed but not under implementation.
